jhelp.util.thread

Class Conditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.util.thread.Conditions

  • public class Conditions
extends java.lang.Object
    Create and manage conditions for launching thread.
    For example if a thread A need wait that an other thread B have finish computing something (But B may still running to do other work) create a condition C. Then invalidate C with invalidate(String). Then launch B and register A with waitFor(String, ThreadedTask, Object). In B when the condition is complete call validate(String). It will launch A.
    If condition is complete before A is register, A will be launch as soon as possible after the registering.
    Important, by default a condition is consider like valid, you have to invalidate it to make it invalid
    Author:
    JHelp

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate(java.lang.String condition)
        Invalidate a condition.
        All thread that register, for the given condition, will wait for someone who call validate(String)
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition to invalidate

      • waitFor

        public <PARAMETER> void waitFor(java.lang.String condition,
                       ThreadedTask<PARAMETER,?,?> task,
                       PARAMETER parameter)
        Register a thread to wait a condition to be valid before launch.
        If the condition is already valid (As by default) the thread is launch as soon as possible
        Type Parameters:
        PARAMETER - Thread parameter type
        Parameters:
        condition - Condition to wait
        task - Thread to launch
        parameter - Thread parameter
